Job Title: Senior Manager, Marketing Communications - Hybrid

Location: San Jose, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
Why join Stryker?

We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com

The Senior Manager, Marketing Communications is responsible for a consolidated and integrated leadership approach to all external communication and public relations activities across the Endoscopy Division’s Business Units.

This role is a hybrid position. This position is required to be based out of the Dallas, San Jose, Denver, or Phoenix locations.

Who we want:

Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented professionals who create a track record of success. Dedicated achievers. People who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations. Effective communicators. People who can interpret information clearly and accurately to concisely communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders. Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices. 

What you will do:

Translate business objectives and strategy into compelling content for specific audiences by collaborating with business teams and functional groups to plan, create, and enhance their communication strategies.Lead cross-divisional efforts and teams for all major trade shows to align on messaging, engagement opportunities, research, maximizing Stryker’s presence, brand, and ROI.Seek out opportunities to enhance and expand our customer reach via communications through best practice sharing across divisions and extending into the industry to build a strategy for maintaining our competitive advantage.Develop marketing communication competencies among marketing teams, educating the product teams and dedicated BU MarComm representatives on the value and expected outcomes of marketing communications, aligned to the strategic direction of the corporation.Empower business unit ownership of content through streamlined processes, best practice sharing, and consistent evaluation of success metrics.Manage and maintain campaign calendar for external communication activities across all the business units to keep track of project status, establish priorities, and tracking deliverables.Partner and collaborate closely with strategic communications function to identify opportunities for leverageLead cross-divisional collaborative campaigns for the division and sits on cross-divisional marketing and communication committees.Cultivate and implements national media opportunities to elevate and promote Endoscopy’s brand and strategic imperatives, as well as opportunities for Endoscopy’s executive leadership team to further Stryker’s reputation and product promotion through the media.Partner with Corporate Marketing and Corporate Communications to shape the brand hierarchy for the Endoscopy division, working with the product teams to understand the strategic roadmap for our products, and how to communicate that roadmap to our customers and internal stakeholders.Develops and executes a divisional public relations strategy, proactively engaging key media outlets, and assisting team in managing designated PR firms.Manages key agency partners for the division, monitoring spend, agency performance, areas of opportunity and service levels for the division.Partners closely with corporate procurement on identifying areas to maximize and leverage marketing communications spend.Generate ideas and provide support to promote and grow the global brand; work closely with BUs and Product Managers to define, produce and execute marketing campaigns aligned to corporate strategy.Serve as the brand leader for the Endoscopy division, working with designated brand implementers to ensure all internal and external comms are developed in line with brand guidelines and that a consistent customer experience is delivered across the Global Endoscopy business, supporting divisional and cross-divisional campaigns.Monitor key competitor communications, use insight to make recommendations as to how to enhance Stryker’s communication performance and create differentiation for our customers.Maintain a high degree of self-motivation, generate fresh ideas and foster positive team interaction.Act in the best interest of Stryker, reflecting the values of teamwork, collaboration and mutual respect.

What you need:

Bachelor’s degree required10+ years of work experience requiredDegree in marketing, communications or related field preferred7+ years medical device or marketing/communications experience preferred4+ years of people management experience preferred

$112,800 - $239,800 salary plus bonus eligible + benefits. Actual minimum and maximum may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience, and other relevant factors.

About Stryker

Our benefits:

12 paid holidays annually Health benefits include: Medical and prescription drug insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, critical illness insurance, accident insurance, hospital indemnity insurance, personalized healthcare support, wellbeing program and tobacco cessation program.Financial benefits include Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), 401(k) plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), basic life and AD&D insurance, and short-term disability insurance. 

For a more detailed overview of our benefits or time off, please follow this link to learn more: US Stryker employee benefits

About Stryker

Stryker is a global leader in medical technologies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 130 million patients annually. More information is available at stryker.com.

Know someone at Stryker?

Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program on our referral page

Stryker is driven to work together with our customers to make healthcare better. Employees and new hires in sales and field roles that require access to customer accounts as a function of the job may be required, depending on customer requirements, to obtain various vaccinations as an essential function of their role.

Experience Level (if available): None
